246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (20:05): Does anyone here have an X4{1,2}00 with 73 GB disks in it running Solaris? If so, could you please show me the 'format' output (I need to check the number of cyls/heads/sectors).
9a6721b432c9da739474674a3138428c (20:06): why would you need that?

246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (20:07): WoDan: because I cannot get SVM to work: I have two (Original Sun) Fujitsu disks in it, but they have a completely different geometry, and one is 15MB bigger than the other.
9a6721b432c9da739474674a3138428c (20:07): make your partitions on the second disk the same size or a tad bigger
9a6721b432c9da739474674a3138428c (20:07): and set up your mirroring
246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (20:08): That would mean that I can no longer jumpstart them, but have to manually partition disks, figuring out cylinder boundaries etc? That seems wrong.
9a6721b432c9da739474674a3138428c (20:09): there's a lot wrong with solaris ;)
246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (20:11): But do you have an X4100, that way I could find out which disk is reporting the wrong geometry.
9a6721b432c9da739474674a3138428c (20:12): only enterprise sparcs
246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (20:13): On Sparc this always worked.
62115b1ea90366cbcce7a495fa28cbce (20:13): 0. c0t0d0 <SUN72G cyl 14087 alt 2 hd 24 sec 424>
62115b1ea90366cbcce7a495fa28cbce (20:13): Vendor: FUJITSU  Product: MAW3073NCSUN72G  Revision: 1703 Serial No: 0620B0EB03
62115b1ea90366cbcce7a495fa28cbce (20:13): from a v240, but 73G fujitsu disks..
246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (20:14): Stric: thanks - but that's not a SAS disk I think.
62115b1ea90366cbcce7a495fa28cbce (20:14): I'm pretty sure it's not :)

246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (20:21): Jumpstart on i386pc should delete all fdisk partitions, make one fdisk partition, then do the type thing mdasv suggested, and then continue with building the vtoc.
abe59155aa41ae19e4ea964e9dd4b200 (20:24): http://www.bagdadsoftware.de")

246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (20:28): Docs say: "If the fdisk keyword is not specified in a profile, the following fdisk keyword is used by default: fdisk all solaris maxfree'. So the problem is really the 'type' thing only.
246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (20:29): (Why do I always start quotations with another type of quotation mark than I end them with?)

9a6721b432c9da739474674a3138428c (20:31): you'd better find a solution where that doesn't matter ;P

246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (20:34): Oh, now this fffing does it. I run format, the disks are the same. I exit format, run format again.. and now 1 disk is 2 cyls smaller!

a0c7d76281a0f43758c0761dce7a1573 (21:37): ofcourse if it really does mean or higher you could try a 2.10 one
